title: Data Modeling Patterns
subject: MongoDB
theory:
Specific design patterns solve common NoSQL problems. 
1. Bucket: Grouping streams of data (IoT) into time buckets.
2. Computed: Storing calculated sums (e.g., total_sales) to avoid aggregation on read.
3. Attribute: Handling highly variable fields.

examples.explanation: We don't need to sum orders array every time we display profile.

interview_questions.question: Explain the Bucket Pattern.
interview_questions.answer: Instead of 1 doc per sensor reading, store 1 doc per hour containing an array of readings. Reduces index size and number of documents.

real_world_use_cases.description: Storing temperature readings every minute. Using Bucketing prevents creating millions of tiny documents.

exam_notes: Subset pattern (keep recent data in doc, move old to another collection).
summary: Patterns like Bucket, Computed, and Subset let you scale widely used features efficiently.
